a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Historical price of computer memory and storage
This data is expressed in US dollars per terabyte (TB), adjusted for inflation. "Memory" refers to random access
memory (RAM), "disk" to magnetic storage, "flash" to special memory used for rapid data access and rewriting,
Data source: John C. McCallum (2023); U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics (2024)
Note: For each year, the time series shows the cheapest historical price recorded until that year. This data is expressed in constant
